operations.notes:
Creates Ship item for any combination of basic and detailed information.
Note that the type of ship data must be specified in the sourceType of Ais, Manual, or External.

This is the primary means of searching ships.
It represents an array of ships that meet the specified search parameters.
Note that only one of the 'search' types of query 'Parameter Types' can be set at a time
    (only one of imoNumber, lastUpdate, mmsiNumber, or shipName).
Note that the returned array of ships is paged.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Allows links to be expanded inline.
Values: detail

parameters.name: imoNumber
parameters.description: Return all ships that have a complete or partial IMO match.

parameters.name: lastUpdate
parameters.description:
Return all ships that have had data updated or have been created since the given datetime.

    Example Value: 2019-03-14T14:55:00Z specifies a year-month-day followed by 24-hour hours:minutes:seconds in GMT time

Note that to support usability the pagination query is ignored with this argument; all matched items will be returned.

parameters.name: mmsiNumber
parameters.description: Return all ships that have a complete or partial MMSI match.

parameters.name: shipName
parameters.description: Return all ships that have a complete or partial Ship Name match.

responseMessages.message: Success. See the 'Response Class' section above for the description of the data.
Bad Request. Typically invalid or incomplete parameter(s). See the 'message' property for detail of the error.
Insufficient authorization. Basic Authentication is missing, invalid, or permissions are insufficient for the operation.

operations.notes: This is the root representation of a specific ship object; it provides sufficient identification information to represent the ship object to the user. In addition to this data, it provides links to children and other associated objects, allowing one to gather all available information about a stored ship.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description:
Allows links to be expanded inline.
Values: detail

responseMessages.message: Success. See the 'Response Class' section above for the description of the data.
Bad Request. Typically invalid or incomplete parameter(s). See the 'message' property for detail of the error.
Insufficient authorization. Basic Authentication is missing, invalid, or permissions are insufficient for the operation.

operations.notes:
Updates Ship item for any combination of basic and detailed information.
Note that the type of ship data must be specified in the sourceType of Ais, Manual, or External.
Note that unset input results in no change.
This endpoint returns additional ship details including ship registry, construction, characteristics and contact information.

responseMessages.message: Success. See the 'Response Class' section above for the description of the data.
Bad Request. Typically invalid or incomplete parameter(s). See the 'message' property for detail of the error.
Insufficient authorization. Basic Authentication is missing, invalid, or permissions are insufficient for the operation.

aisShipTypeCode.description: Numerical code representation of the ship type and cargo from ITU-R M.1371 {Source AIS Transponder}

grossTonnage.description: Overall internal volume of the ship

classificationSociety.description: The non-governmental organization that has validated and classified this ship

aisShipType.description: *method=GET*String representation of the ship type and cargo {Source AIS Transponder}

emailAddress.description: Standard email address to contact ship or ship liaison

links.description:
*method=GET*Provides link relations as URLs using the REST 'hateoas' convention (for REST delivered data).
    The 'self' link references this rest object, including any specified query criteria,
    The 'rel/portOfRegistry' link references the ship's port of registry

registryPort.description: *method=POST_OR_PUT*This is the 'locode'; the International code for uniquely identifying this port

deadWeight.description: Dead weight / carrying capacity of the ship (tons)

id.description: the resource identifier; the ship id

passengerCapacity.description: Maximum number of passenger supported by this ship

yearOfBuild.description: Four digit representation of the year the ship was built

maxCapacity.description: Maximum capacity including crew, support personnel and passengers

crewSize.description: Standard crew size required to operate this ship

vesselClass.description: The classification given to this ship by the classification society

formerNames.description: Former names that have been used by this ship

otherShipIds.description: Additional identification numbers associated with this ship {key/value pairs}

inmarsatNumber.description: Contact number for ships fitted with Inmarsat

phoneNumber.description: Standard phone number to contact ship or ship liaison

faxNumber.description: Standard fax number to contact ship or ship liaison

aisDestArrTime.description:
Ship Destination arrival time as per AIS.
    Example Value: 2019-03-14T14:55:00Z specifies a year-month-day followed by 24-hour hours:minutes:seconds in GMT time

url.description: URL resulting in this error message

links.description:
*method=GET*Provides link relations as URLs using the REST 'hateoas' convention (for REST delivered data).
    The 'self' link references this rest object, including any specified query criteria

idValue.description: The actual identification value asociated with this idType

idType.description: The name or key describing this type of identifier

shipDetail.description: Provides additional ship details including ship registry, construction, characteristics and contact information

fullName.description: Full ship name. {Populated by aisName if nothing else has been entered}

flagUrl.description: *method=GET*Image URL to the ship's registered country's flag

aisName.description: AIS representation of name. {Source AIS Transponder}

sourceType.description: *method=POST_OR_PUT*['Ais' or 'Manual' or 'External']: The source type of the data

links.description:
*method=GET*Provides link relations as URLs using the REST 'hateoas' convention (for REST delivered data).
    The 'self' link references this rest object, including any specified query criteria,
    The 'rel/detail' link references the ship's detailed information,
    The 'rel/countries' link references the ship's registered country

id.description: the resource identifier; the ship id

thumbnailUrl.description: *method=GET*Image URL to the ship's primary photo

links.description:
*method=GET*Provides link relations as URLs using the REST 'hateoas' convention (for REST delivered data).
    The 'self' link references this rest object, including any specified query criteria

ships.description: An array of Ships matching the query criteria

totalItems.description: Total number of elements matching the query filter and not limited by page size

country.description: *method=POST_OR_PUT*Alpha 3 Code as per ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 codes

lastReported.description:
Date the ship was last reported with this name.
    Example Value: 2019-03-14T14:55:00Z specifies a year-month-day followed by 24-hour hours:minutes:seconds in GMT time

links.description:
*method=GET*Provides link relations as URLs using the REST 'hateoas' convention (for REST delivered data).
    The 'self' link references this rest object, including any specified query criteria
    The 'rel/country' link references the ship's registered country during this time

callSign.description: Previous Call Sign of the ship
